channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.description: The latest stories from the Europe section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gaddafi envoy has talks in London
item.description: A Libyan envoy representing Colonel Gaddafi has been in London in the past few days for talks with British officials, the BBC understands.

item.title: Bosnia handed Fifa football ban
item.description: Bosnia-Hercegovina are suspended from world football after refusing to comply with governing body Fifa's regulations.

item.title: UN rejects Georgia case over war
item.description: The United Nations' top court rejects a case filed by Georgia that accuses Russia and separatist rebels of ethnic cleansing.

item.title: Italy moves migrants to mainland
item.description: Italy moves 1,716 North African migrants to a mainland camp site, easing overcrowding on the isle of Lampedusa.

item.title: German state sued by nuclear firm
item.description: German energy giant RWE takes legal action against the state of Hesse after being ordered to close a nuclear power plant.

item.title: Bank of Ireland shares jump 36%
item.description: Bank of Ireland shares jump as investors hope the government will not take a majority stake in the firm following bank stress tests.

item.title: Austria 'Obama-mask robber' held
item.description: Austria police have arrested a man suspected of robbing banks while wearing a mask of US President Barack Obama.

item.title: 'Bomb plot' at Borussia Dortmund
item.description: German police say they have detained a 25-year-old man after three suspected explosive devices were found outside Borussia Dortmund's stadium.

item.title: Portugal misses borrowing target
item.description: The Portuguese governments admits it overshot its 2010 budget deficit target, sending its cost of borrowing to yet new highs.

item.title: M&S to return to French market
item.description: Marks and Spencer says it is to re-enter the French retail market, 10 years after shutting down its European stores.

item.title: Judo medallist falls to her death
item.description: Austrian judo medallist Claudia Heill, who won silver at the Athens Olympics, dies after falling from a sixth-floor window in Vienna.

item.title: Sarkozy calls for nuclear rules
item.description: The French president calls for clear international standards on nuclear safety as the crisis at Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant continues.

item.title: 'Historic day' for South Downs National Park
item.description: Supporters herald a 'historic day' as the South Downs National Park Authority becomes fully operational.

item.title: Chef prodigy feeds entire Belfast school
item.description: Award-winning teenage chef cooks up a storm for school dinners

item.title: Eurozone unemployment rate falls
item.description: Unemployment among the 17 EU countries that make up the eurozone falls below the 10% barrier, according to the latest statistics

item.title: Irish manufacturing 'holding up'
item.description: The Irish Republic's manufacturing sector is doing well in spite of the crisis in the country's banking system, a survey indicates.

item.title: Nadal v Federer in Miami
item.description: Rafael Nadal will play Roger Federer in the US for the first time in six years, in the Sony Ericsson Open semi-finals.

item.title: Paatelainen is new Finland boss
item.description: Mixu Paatelainen leaves Kilmarnock to take over as the manager of Finland.

item.title: Guard arrested near 2012 stadium
item.description: A security guard is arrested near the Olympic Stadium in east London on suspicion of possessing explosives.

item.title: VIDEO: European Parliament
item.description: European Parliament president Jerzy Buzek has promised a "zero tolerance" approach to corruption amongst MEPs.

item.title: Monaco
item.description: An overview of Monaco including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: San Marino
item.description: An overview of San Marino including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Abkhazia
item.description: An overview of Abkhazia including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media.

item.title: Ajaria
item.description: An overview of Ajaria including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Ceuta, Melilla
item.description: A profile of the Spanish north African enclaves of Ceuta and Melilla

item.title: Channel Islands
item.description: An overview of the Channel Islands including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Corsica
item.description: An overview of Corsica including key facts and notes on the media

item.title: Isle of Man
item.description: An overview of the Isle of Man including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Kabardino-Balkaria
item.description: A profile of the southern Russian republic

item.title: Kosovo
item.description: An overview of Kosovo including key facts, leaders and notes on the media

item.title: South Ossetia
item.description: An overview of South Ossetia, including key facts and political leaders

item.title: Trans-Dniester
item.description: An overview of the breakaway region in eastern Moldova

item.title: VIDEO: Actress Lyudmila Gurchenko mourned
item.description: Actress Lyudmila Gurchenko, described as ''Russia's Elizabeth Taylor'', has died at the age of 75.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Message in a bottle' answered in Russia
item.description: A German boy who tossed a message in a bottle off a ship in the Baltic Sea some 24 years ago has now received an answer.

item.title: VIDEO: Migrants to be moved from Lampedusa
item.description: The unrest in North Africa has seen thousands of migrants from Libya and Tunisia flee to Lampedusa, an Italian island in the Mediterranean.

item.title: VIDEO: Spain investigates baby trade claims
item.description: Spanish prosecutors launch nationwide investigation into claims of an illicit trade in newborn babies

item.title: VIDEO: Irish banks need extra 24bn euros
item.description: The Republic of Ireland's banks need an extra 24bn euros (£21.2bn) to survive the financial crisis.

item.title: VIDEO: Stars turn out for Gorbachev event
item.description: Former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev is being honoured at a spectacular concert at the Royal Albert Hall in London to celebrate his 80th birthday.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Cockleshell hero' on his WWII mission
item.description: As a memorial is unveiled to the commandos of the "Cockleshell" raid in 1942, veteran Norman Colley reflects on the mission

item.title: VIDEO: Macedonia: What's in a name?
item.description: For almost two decades, Macedonia has been locked in a row with Greece over its name.

item.title: Grand strategy
item.description: German football is united on its long-term goals

item.title: Embracing 3D
item.description: Ballet and opera experiment with three-dimensional cinema

item.title: Bordeaux bravery
item.description: Memorial marks secret mission of WWII 'Cockleshell heroes'

item.title: Spanish tragedy
item.description: The babies taken from their parents and never seen again

item.title: Scorpions and Spice
item.description: Eclectic guests at London gala to honour Gorbachev

item.title: Pippi's legacy
item.description: Fans on plans to send Sweden's literary darling to Hollywood

item.title: Testing times
item.description: Turkey's foreign minister reflects on Libya policy
